post.body: It should. The response time is not as fast as Twitter app, but it is working for me (at least right now).
Yeah, I need a pure road bike though. I'm current riding one of these right now. http://is.gd/byuc (which is ok, but . . .)
Very cool. I'm still much of a newbie, but I am training for 3 sprint-triathlons & 1 olympic triathlon in 2009. Lovin' it.
Maybe we can get a game in before we fly north on Wednesday. I think if we get a group to play, the kids will likely come out.
Thanks Art! I will try.
Do you race? If so, what kind of races?
Yay. Just admit it Tim. You were irresistibly drawn. Did you get the macbook pro?
Here in SW Florida right now. We are starting east and then looking to plant south and north as well.
Bryant's got plenty of snakes to pass around, trust me. You never know what you're gonna get into at our CP meetings!
I'm helping lead a church planting initiative at our church which has begun w/ the planting of our first church.
Yes, but I don't remember all the details(!). My apologies. Been a fast-paced last couple of months.
It's going really good. Just finished teaching on the centrality of the church in God's redemptive mission. Very encouraged.
Wow! Huge congrats to you guys! That's so exciting!
Well, that's the name of the fight song, so on this occasion. . . :)
amazing self portrait Ed! This should be your professor profile pic. ;)
I prayed for you this morning brother. Please keep us informed and how we can pray. May God satisfy you with his goodness.
I would, but I am not a coffee drinker. ;) I deferred for apple juice.
Is it canceled due to the economy (low registration)? I wonder how many conferences will be canceled because of it.
Yeah, I heard about that. I was given a reading plan but wasn't sure if it was from them. I suppose I should ask anyway.
Is it the one from Foundation for Reformed Theology?
I can also play the wii in a snuggie, but unfortunately I have neither, though love offerings will not be refused. ;)
I've got a reading plan from my fellow pastor, @tomascol, but I don't know where it came from. It might be the one you have.
Very cool about Edwards. Some things just need to be read over and over on a regular basis.
Unfortunately, I was just a "package handler." But were I handling the visa, I would have "handled it much better than that!
I'll play the role of the UPS man. Is that okay?
That's hilarious. How about you Joe?
Although Twitter is said to be working on the Facebook app failure -> http://is.gd/bvxt I've followed others & gone with Tweeter.
Any Grace folks want to join a missional game of kickball in the Brister field of dreams?
Just finished mowing a regulation size kickball field next to the house for the kids in my neighborhood. If you mow it, they will come.
Commending Christ -> compassion + confrontation in conversation. http://is.gd/buXM
An encouraging word from Piper on the stewardship of grace in hospitality. http://is.gd/buLP
http://twitpic.com/sdif - Okay, I promise we're not planting a snake-handling church, although we do have snake-handlers. ;)
The moonrise is amazing. Scientists are saying it will be brighter due to its temporary proximity. Check it.
Ugh. Two hours of laying horizontal due to the crud. No energy but still excited to go to church planting meeting (last scheduled of year).
Party time at Logan's! http://twitpic.com/u13x
RT @tomascol: RTS provides a daily reading schedule of the Institutes 4 09 in celebration of Calvin's 500th bi-day http://tinyurl.com/3trd5z
RT @anderson_scott: I just made a Twitter Group at http://twittgroups.com/group/desiringgod called Desiring God. Check it out & join!
RT @GeoffSurratt: Is Jesus the only way to Heaven? Survey says....no. http://tinyurl.com/527476
Just saw where @tedolsen is now on Twitter.
Wishing my son a HAPPY BIRTHDAY!!! Nolan turns the big uno today! Yay! Party time!
Really random night tonight, includying TokBox, reading, planning, bookmarking, and researching.
Really enjoying the daily pics from the Hubble Space Telescope 2008 Advent Calendar http://is.gd/cfz0 (how great is our God!)
At my parent's house enjoying mama's cooking, papa's goofy commentary, and the fact that I can actually wear a toboggan & sweatshirt.
Shopping at my hometown Wal-Mart is not exactly the easiest thing to do to say the least.
Cousins unite! http://twitpic.com/tnf2
Alabama is the only state that the flight attendant plays the fight song upon arrival. Yea Alabama!
Donald Whitney didn't tell me that writing with a fountain pen at 35,000 feet was a very bad idea. Moleskine & hands absorbed the damage.
Nolan's handling the lack of sleep really well. Such a big boy. :) http://twitpic.com/tkzf
Got the munchies at 6:00. Downed a jumbo size bag of Jack Links beef jerky. Breakfast of champions.
Quick Hits of Random Blog Notes -> http://is.gd/ehUC
Anyone planning on reading through Calvin's Institutes in 2009 (500th anniversary of Calvin's birth)? If so, do you have a reading plan?
I think I can watch the Snuggie commercials 100 times and it never get old. I would love to know if anyone has actually bough one.
Exegeting a passage w/ 3 illustrations of 2nd Temple Judaism is a hermeneutical mine field. Reminding myself of the perspecuity of Scripture
New 2 Vol. biography of George Whitefield (1172 pp) (foreword by Packer; preface by Richard Owen Roberts) -> http://is.gd/edSQ
Finally got around to posting my list of the Top 25 Christian Books of 2008. http://is.gd/ebV8 Check it.
RT @abrahampiper: Nearing the 1,000-word mark of a novel I started a month ago. Look for it Summer, 2017. (22 words at a time). :)
Mowing the (overgrown) yard in 80+ degree weather. Someone remind me that it is late December please. Next: mow "Brister field of dreams".
Man I love our widows. We've got the sweetest, most gracious ladies in the world!
Funerals are such a sobering means of grace. Oh the brevity of life & glory of the resurrection! Let none say, "I've wasted it!"
Meditating on God's faithfulness from one generation to another while preparing devotional thoughts for our staff and widows luncheon today.
